text: hi I'm a mailart with AWS with AWS you
have the flexibility to run SQL server
in a number of different ways whether
it's as a fully managed service like
relational database Services RDS or
having the ability to configure every
windows or SQL setting when you deploy
it on ec2 Amazon RDS frees you up to
focus on application development by
managing timec consuming data databased
Administration tasks including
provisioning backups software patching
monitoring and Hardware
scaling Amazon RDS supports multi-
availability zones providing increased
availability data durability and Fa
tolerance for database instances with
AWS you can also purchase SQL in a pure
consumption model paying only for what
you use thereby managing and controlling
your resources helping you reduce costs
and maximize utilization if you have
more predict and stable applications you
can purchase Reserve capacity and
benefit from significant discounts AWS
also gives you flexibility to decide how
you want to purchase your Microsoft
licenses you can buy directly from AWS
either through ec2 with SQL RDS or AWS
Marketplace or you can bring your own
from your existing Microsoft agreements
